title:
I wish you a joyful Sunday

Photo taken  in Giverny, auberge Baudy a few days ago.

attachments.displayName:
I wish you a joyful Sunday

Photo taken  in Giverny, auberge Baudy a few days ago.
A place where you can eat for a sensible price good traditionnal French inn cuisine.

At the end of 19th century, the place was a café managed by Misses Baudy and in the studio mister Baudy stored the sewing machines he sold.
Then one day, some sort of a tramp, gabbling a strange language came. Misses Baudy was to send him away but she noticed his painting attire, which she recognized because of a renown inhabitant of Giverny : Claude Monet.
The Guy was named Metcalf, he belonged to an american painting academy and came back a few weeks later with a bunch of colleagues. They lodge in the café, turned in a painter's inn with two studios under its roof or rent bedrooms from the villagers. A studio is also built in the garden and misses Baudy has added painting supplies to her groceries....
The young americans formed a joyous gang and put much animation in the village, behaving very differently from the quiet family man that was mister Monet.

A few years after, the painters went back in their country, Monet died and the villlage fell asleep for many years.

Then, Monet's garden and house became a museum. Afterwards came the american impressionism museum and its wonderful colored gardens, now museum of Impressionisms. And Hotel Baudy and its garden and studio garden were revamped and a fantastic roses garden created.

object.content:
I wish you a joyful Sunday

Photo taken  in Giverny, auberge Baudy a few days ago. 
A place where you can eat for a sensible price good traditionnal French inn cuisine.

At the end of 19th century, the place was a café managed by Misses Baudy and in the studio mister Baudy stored the sewing machines he sold. 
Then one day, some sort of a tramp, gabbling a strange language came. Misses Baudy was to send him away but she noticed his painting attire, which she recognized because of a renown inhabitant of Giverny : Claude Monet.
The Guy was named Metcalf, he belonged to an american painting academy and came back a few weeks later with a bunch of colleagues. They lodge in the café, turned in a painter's inn with two studios under its roof or rent bedrooms from the villagers. A studio is also built in the garden and misses Baudy has added painting supplies to her groceries....
The young americans formed a joyous gang and put much animation in the village, behaving very differently from the quiet family man that was mister Monet.

A few years after, the painters went back in their country, Monet died and the villlage fell asleep for many years.

Then, Monet's garden and house became a museum. Afterwards came the american impressionism museum and its wonderful colored gardens, now museum of Impressionisms. And Hotel Baudy and its garden and studio garden were revamped and a fantastic roses garden created.
